item.title: One of the most annoying Command Problems Ever =.="
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

[quote=“cocoa, post:12, topic:303478”][quote author=Epic Ancient link=topic=399798.msg2965899#msg2965899 date=1253572185]

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("ground"){ heightLevel = 0; teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; updateRequired = true; }

It looks like it would work, BUT NOTHING DOES!?!?!? :
[/quote]

You have to try first you twat.[/quote]

Simply put: I DID. -.-"

Read full topic

item.title: One of the most annoying Command Problems Ever =.="
item.dc:creator: @PKingKingScape PKingKingScape
item.description:
@PKingKingScape wrote:

Well, I don’t know that much code or anything. (else, if, public, void, boolean etc)…
BUT, couldnt you make a command that is like project fallouts but has 2 more lines with the location you are on i
Maybe a bit like this:

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("ground"){
heightLevel = 1;
teleportToX = CurrentLocationX;
teleportToY = CurrentLocationY;
}

See the ‘Current Locations’?? I don’t know what the code for something like that is, but I hope you get what I mean lol.

Read full topic

item.title: One of the most annoying Command Problems Ever =.="
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

I finally had to go =.=" on a problem. It’s just that annoying!

Look, on my server, if you teleport to any height level that isn’t 0, (my Corporal Beast is on Heighlevel = 2) you get stuck there for some ungodly reason. My height-changing commands don’t seem to want to work with anyone but me, so…

I ask the more-so-pro coders to help with this command (I just recently created from my head .-. Ik it seems fail):

I have 3 possible ways thought up of setting your height level to 0.

} if (command.startsWith("grounded")) { teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; heightLevel += 0; } else if heightLevel >= 1 teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; set(heightLevel = 0);

Simplistic, but I don’t think it would work. :\

} if (command.startsWith("ground")) { teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; heightLevel += 0; } else if heighLevel = 1 teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; heightLevel -= 1; } else if heighLevel = 2 teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; heightLevel -= 2; } else if heighLevel = 3 teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; heightLevel -= 3; } else if heighLevel = 4 teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; heightLevel -= 4; } else if heighLevel = 5 teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; heightLevel -= 5; } else if heighLevel = -1 teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; heightLevel += 1; } else if heighLevel = -2 teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; heightLevel += 2; } else if heighLevel = -3 teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; heightLevel += 3; } else if heighLevel = -4 teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; heightLevel += 4; } else if heighLevel = -5 teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; heightLevel += 5;

Long, but seems better to me.

} if (command.startsWith("ground")) { teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; heightLevel += 0; } else if heightLevel >= 1 teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; set(heightLevel = 0);

Like the first one, but better?

HALP. ;-; This is grinding my coding power down to a stub. People keep getting stuck ;-;

Read full topic
